metadata.Description: A technology that harnesses the temperature difference between warm surface water and cold deep water to generate electricity.

entities.Description: Agencies that promote and support the development and use of renewable energy sources.
Energy derived from the sun's radiation and converted into usable forms such as electricity or heat.
The use of less energy to provide the same level of output or service, resulting in reduced energy consumption, cost savings, and environmental benefits.
The process of capturing and storing energy for later use.
A technology that harnesses the temperature difference between warm surface water and cold deep water to generate electricity.

relations.Description: Ocean thermal energy conversion addresses climate change adaptation by providing a sustainable energy solution that reduces reliance on fossil fuels.
relations.Subject: ocean thermal energy conversion

relations.Description: Ocean thermal energy conversion employs heat exchangers to convert temperature differences in ocean water into usable energy.
relations.Subject: ocean thermal energy conversion

relations.Description: Ocean thermal energy conversion collaborates with coastal communities to implement sustainable energy solutions and support local economies.
relations.Subject: ocean thermal energy conversion

relations.Description: Ocean thermal energy conversion supports research in renewable energy technologies to improve efficiency and expand the use of sustainable energy sources.
relations.Subject: ocean thermal energy conversion

relations.Description: Ocean thermal energy conversion administers government incentive programs to promote the adoption of sustainable energy technologies.
relations.Subject: ocean thermal energy conversion

relations.Description: Ocean thermal energy conversion measures ocean temperature to identify suitable locations for harnessing thermal energy.
relations.Subject: ocean thermal energy conversion

relations.Description: Ocean thermal energy conversion aligns with the Sustainable Development Goals by providing a clean and renewable energy source for sustainable development.
relations.Subject: ocean thermal energy conversion

relations.Description: Ocean thermal energy conversion is an instance of ocean energy, which utilizes temperature differences in ocean water to generate electricity.
relations.Subject: ocean thermal energy conversion
renewable energy agencies
relations.Description: Renewable energy agencies employ experts in the field of renewable energy to drive innovation and promote the adoption of clean energy technologies.

relations.Subject: renewable energy agencies
relations.Description: Renewable energy agencies collaborate with research institutions to advance scientific knowledge and develop new technologies for renewable energy generation.

relations.Subject: solar energy
relations.Description: Solar energy implements Energy Efficiency Policy by promoting the use of energy-saving designs and materials.

relations.Subject: solar energy
relations.Description: Solar energy funds Research and Development to improve solar panel efficiency and develop new technologies.

relations.Subject: renewable energy agencies
relations.Description: Renewable energy agencies employ experts in the field of renewable energy to drive innovation and promote the adoption of clean energy technologies.

relations.Subject: energy efficiency
relations.Description: Energy efficiency measures address energy waste by promoting the use of energy-efficient technologies and practices.
A cold water pipe is a sub-component of ocean thermal energy conversion systems. It is responsible for transporting cold water from the deep ocean to the power plant.
relations.Subject: cold water pipe

relations.Description: A warm water pipe is a sub-component of ocean thermal energy conversion systems. It is responsible for transporting warm surface water to the power plant.
relations.Subject: warm water pipe

relations.Description: A power plant is a sub-component of ocean thermal energy conversion systems. It converts the temperature difference between warm surface water and cold deep water into electricity.
relations.Subject: power plant

relations.Description: A heat exchanger is a sub-component of ocean thermal energy conversion systems. It transfers heat between the warm and cold water streams, allowing for efficient energy conversion.
relations.Subject: heat exchanger

relations.Description: A turbine is a sub-component of ocean thermal energy conversion systems. It uses the pressure of the flowing water to generate mechanical power, which is then converted into electricity.
relations.Subject: turbine
